DOC.brief_summary: The PRESENT-P study one-arm exercise intervention study hematological cancer patient prior allogeneic stem cell transplantation ( allo-HCT ) . This pilot study investigate prehabilitation approach safety feasibility high-intensity exercise program directly prior transplantation .
DOC.brief_title: Pre-Exercise Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The major objective PRESENT-P investigate feasibility safety high intensity endurance exercise training ( HIIT ) progressive resistance exercise prior allo-HCT . This multicenter pilot study include n=30 patient . Patients perform two supervised exercise session per week . Recruitment take place 6-12 week prior allogeneic stem cell transplantation . Further aim pilot study : estimate number eligible patient , evaluate recruitment procedure , explore effect HIIT prior allo-HCT maximal oxygen uptake ( VO2peak ) , submaximal endurance capacity , muscle strength , patient-reported-outcomes include QoL physical functioning .
DOC.criteria: Hematological cancer , e.g . AML , CLL , MM Scheduled alloHCT University Clinic Heidelberg cooperation site within next 412 week Patients ≥ 18 year age Sufficient German language skill Willing/ able train provide exercise facility twice per week take part schedule testing Signed informed consent Heart insufficiency > NYHA III uncertain arrhythmia Uncontrolled hypertension Severe renal dysfunction ( GFR < 30 % , Creatinine > 3mg/dl ) Reduced stand walk ability Insufficient hematological capacity ( either hemoglobin value 8 g/dl thrombocyte 30.000/µL ) Any comorbidities preclude participation exercise program Engaging systematic intense exercise training ( least 1h twice per week )
